original_theorem:
If $\{F_n\}$ converges uniformly to $F$ on $S$ and each $F_n$ is
continuous at a point $x_0$ in $S,$ then so is $F$. Similar
statements hold for continuity from the right and left$.$

    (h_cont_fn : ‚àÄ n, ContinuousAt (F n) x‚ÇÄ) :
    ContinuousAt f x‚ÇÄ := by

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem uniform_convergence_preserves_continuity {Œ± Œ≤ : Type*} [TopologicalSpace Œ±] [MetricSpace Œ≤]
    {F : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {s : Set Œ±} {x‚ÇÄ : Œ±}
    (h_unif : TendstoUniformlyOn F f atTop s)
    (h_cont_fn : ‚àÄ n, ContinuousAt (F n) x‚ÇÄ) :
    ContinuousAt f x‚ÇÄ := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
‚Ä¢ $\{F_n\}$ is a sequence of functions from $S$ to $\mathbb{C}$, $F$ is a function from $S$ to $\mathbb{C}$ [tc_1].
‚Ä¢ $x_0 \in S$ [tc_2].
Therefore, we conclude:
‚Ä¢ For any $x \in S$ and any $n \in \mathbb{N}$, by the triangle inequality, $|F(x)-F(x_0)| \le |F(x)-F_n(x)| + |F_n(x)-F_n(x_0)| + |F_n(x_0)-F(x_0)|$ [l1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
have l1 : ‚àÄ (x : Œ±) (n : ‚Ñï),
      dist (f x) (f x‚ÇÄ) ‚â§ dist (f x) (F n x) + dist (F n x) (F n x‚ÇÄ) + dist (F n x‚ÇÄ) (f x‚ÇÄ) := by
    intros x n
    calc
      dist (f x) (f x‚ÇÄ) = dist (f x) (F n x) + dist (F n x) (F n x‚ÇÄ) + dist (F n x‚ÇÄ) (f x‚ÇÄ) := by
        rw [dist_triangle, dist_triangle]
